channel.title: Living Sports Analytics
channel.description: Latest sports analytics research papers, blog posts, and grey literature ‚Äî curated and classified by AI

item.title: Modeling Event Dynamics by Self-Exciting Processes with Random Memory
item.description: Proposes self-exciting point process models with random memory to capture event clustering and self-excitation patterns in sports competition data.

item.title: Running to the Top: Investigating Running Back Archetypes and Player Trajectories
item.description: Statistical analysis identifies distinct running back archetypes in the NFL and characterizes how these players evolve over their careers.

item.title: Stats for Success: Linebackers and Tight Ends
item.description: Analysis of statistical performance metrics for linebackers and tight ends in American football.

item.title: A Unified Server Quality Metric for Tennis
item.description: Develops serve-specific player metrics using logistic mixed-effects models on point-by-point data to isolate serving quality from overall tennis performance across gender and tournament.

item.title: How Valuable Is the Perfect Kicker?
item.description: Exploratory analysis of elite kicker value in NFL, using Cam Little's record field goal as a case study to quantify positional importance.

item.title: Beyond Expected Goals: A Probabilistic Framework for Shot Occurrences in Soccer
item.description: xG+ framework extends expected goals models by jointly estimating shot occurrence probability and shot quality at the possession level in soccer, improving on traditional xG metrics that only evaluate observed shots.

item.title: Kicking for Goal or Touch? An Expected Points Framework for Penalty Decisions in Rugby Union
item.description: Expected Points framework quantifies the value of penalty decisions (shoot at goal vs. kick to touch) in rugby union as a function of field location and game context using Premiership data.

item.title: Inside the Flags?: A Data-Driven Investigation of NFL Penalties
item.description: Data-driven investigation of NFL penalty decisions examines whether referees exhibit neutral decision-making or contextual bias in flag enforcement.

item.title: Playoff Prophecy: Which Regular Season Stats Spell Postseason Glory?
item.description: Statistical analysis identifies which regular season statistics are most strongly associated with NBA playoff success.

item.title: What Minute Matters Most? Scoring in College Basketball
item.description: Analysis of scoring patterns across different game minutes in college basketball to determine which quarter most influences outcomes.

item.title: Analysing Skill Predominance in Generalized Fantasy Cricket
item.description: Limited-selection fantasy cricket contest framework demonstrates that success is predominantly skill-based rather than chance-based through simulation and real performance data.

item.title: Probabilistic Analysis of Various Squash Shots and Skill Study of Different Levels of Squash Players and Teams
item.description: Probabilistic model of squash matches shows that professional players employ wider shot variety and favor backcourt control compared to intermediate players, with quantifiable skill differences.

item.title: TacEleven: generative tactic discovery for football open play
item.description: TacEleven, a generative deep learning framework for automated discovery of offensive tactics during open play in football, developed with AJ Auxerre to assist coaches and analysts.

item.title: Extreme-Path Benchmarks for Sequential Probability Forecasts
item.description: Develops extreme-path benchmarks to evaluate sequential probability forecasts in sports, addressing how frequently forecast extremes should occur under correct calibration.

item.title: A probabilistic match classification model for sports tournaments
item.description: Develops a probabilistic framework to classify matches in tournaments by simulating outcomes to compute qualifying probabilities and contestant incentives.

item.title: Discovering the NBA Talent in March Madness
item.description: Statistical analysis examines how March Madness performance translates to subsequent NBA success.

item.title: Roaring to Glory
item.description: Case study analysis of the 2023 Florida Panthers' historically unprecedented playoff surge to the Stanley Cup Finals.

item.title: Rao-Blackwellizing FG% with Daniel Daly-Grafstein
item.description: Rao-Blackwellizing methods improve field goal percentage estimation and in-game shot trajectory analysis quantifies defensive impact in the NBA.

item.title: Careful Clustering of Soccer Players
item.description: Paper:

item.title: How often does the best team win with Michael Lopez
item.description: Statistical analysis examines how frequently the best team wins across sports competitions.

item.title: 'Tis the Big Data Bowl season
item.description: Overview of NFL Big Data Bowl as an annual open competition leveraging publicly released player-tracking data to advance American football analytics.

item.title: openWAR with Gregory J. Matthews
item.description: openWAR presents an open-source statistical framework for calculating Wins Above Replacement in baseball.

item.title: True Shot Charts with Justin Ehrlich and Shane Sanders
item.description: Discussion of true shot charts methodology for basketball analysis and shooting performance evaluation.

item.title: Expected Hypothetical Completion Probability with Sameer Deshpande and Katherine Evans
item.description: Discussion of a Bayesian approach to modeling expected hypothetical completion probability in NFL passing plays for evaluating receiver quality.

item.title: Down, set, hut!
item.description: Statistical analysis of snap timing variability in American football plays involving motion to explain performance fluctuations.

item.title: A Statistical Model of Serve Return Impact Patterns in Professional Tennis with Stephanie Kovalchik
item.description: Statistical model predicting serve return impact patterns in professional tennis to evaluate return of serve effectiveness.

item.title: Grinding the Mocks with Benjamin Robinson
item.description: Hierarchical Bayesian modeling approach to predicting NFL draft outcomes using historical draft data and player evaluations.

item.title: Bang the can slowly with Ryan Elmore and Gregory J. Matthews
item.description: Statistical investigation examines the 2017 Houston Astros sign-stealing scandal using novel analytical methods.

item.title: Models for hockey player ratings with Andrew Thomas and Sam Ventura
item.description: Competing process hazard function models provide improved player rating systems for ice hockey.

item.title: Player Chemistry in Soccer with Lotte Bransen
item.description: Statistical analysis quantifies player chemistry effects on team balance and performance in soccer.

item.title: Why it pays to know some nerds in football
item.description: Commentary on the value of employing analytics-minded professionals in soccer organizations.

item.title: üìà2025 NFL Power Ratings and Projectionsüèà
item.description: NFL power ratings and seasonal projections for all teams in 2025.

item.title: üèÅ 2026 NASCAR Cup Series Driver Rankings üöó
item.description: NASCAR Cup Series driver performance rankings tracked throughout the 2026 season.

item.title: Soccer analytics in the 2020s
item.description: Prospective review of the evolution, expected changes, and future directions of soccer analytics in the 2020s.

item.title: Why xG matters
item.description: Essay discussing the importance and applications of expected goals (xG) as an analytical metric in soccer.

item.title: I'm still here!
item.description: Sorry!

item.title: üèÄ 2025-26 NBA Elo Forecast and Player Ratings üìà
item.description: NBA team Elo ratings and forecasts for Finals appearance and victory probabilities throughout the 2025-26 season.

item.title: üèÄ2026 NCAA Tournament Forecast üìä
item.description: NCAA Division I men's basketball tournament probability forecasts for all teams' tournament qualification and championship odds.

item.title: Analytics makes us more human
item.description: Essay on how analytics enhances human decision-making in soccer management.

item.title: Squad age profiles, 2024-25
item.description: Descriptive visualization of squad age profiles across football clubs for the 2024-25 season using an established analytic approach.

item.title: Squad retention in the big European leagues
item.description: Comparative analysis of squad retention across major European leagues, measuring minutes lost from previous season rosters.

item.title: League One scatter graphics: 2024-25
item.description: Descriptive analysis of League One (third-tier) team attacking and defensive performance across the 2024-25 season using scatter plot visualizations.

item.title: Premier League match dashboards
item.description: Development of match dashboards incorporating threat timelines, territory maps, and passing network visualizations for Premier League analysis.

item.title: Early season update: squad retention, table-topping droughts and fixture difficulty
item.description: Summary analysis of early season updates including squad retention metrics, table-topping droughts, and fixture difficulty across Premier League and EFL.

item.title: League Two scatter graphics: 2024-25
item.description: Descriptive analysis of League Two (fourth-tier) team attacking and defensive performance across the 2024-25 season using scatter plot visualizations.

item.title: League table footprints: 2024-25
item.description: Descriptive analysis tracking the duration each football team spent in each league position throughout the 2024-25 season.

item.title: Analysing the 2025-26 Premier League fixtures
item.description: Descriptive analysis of 2025-26 Premier League fixture scheduling to identify easiest and toughest runs for each club.

item.title: Squad retention: 2025-26
item.description: Tracking analysis of league minutes lost by Premier League and EFL teams between seasons to assess squad retention impact.

item.title: Analysing the 2025-26 EFL fixtures
item.description: Descriptive analysis of 2025-26 EFL fixture scheduling to identify easiest and toughest runs for each club.

item.title: Premier League scatter graphics: 2024-25
item.description: Descriptive analysis of Premier League team attacking and defensive performance across the 2024-25 season using scatter plot visualizations.
